alert.note: Alert for Greater Portland Metro Area (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 10:49PM PST until February 23 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING HAS BEEN REPLACED BY A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY, WHICH IS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow at times. Additional snow accumulations of up to 2 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph, especially near the Gorge. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 5 above zero. * WHERE...Greater Portland Metro Area. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 8 AM PST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until noon PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Snow covered roads will linger into the Thursday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavier snow west of Hillsboro will likely result in additional accumulations of 2 to 3 inches overnight for places such as Forest Grove, Cornelius, Banks, and Gales Creek.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
